Thanks man. I had one quick question before I got started. Is the Assassin Improved Invis. caster level fixed, or is it based on Assassin level or character level? You will hit hard enough without the ISA feats. Push dexterity instead.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I think it is time to start a build request thread if you want to go further into the making of lvl 40 builds.

This build here is optimized in several ways for lvl 20 as Max pointed out. Since you want to learn, I will explain:
Starting dexterity is 19 and ends at 24. Starting at 20 and ending at 25 would not gain anything if you can cap dex at lvl 20.
I start taking assassin levels asap and max them out asap, except for a single level of SD for HIPS asap. I want as high DA DC as possible, also during leveling.
I sacrifice 1 BAB for +2 to DA DC by taking a level split with 10 rather than 8 assassin levels, that gives BAB 14
Halfling small stature and good aim add +2 to AB
Int 16 gives +3 to DA DC and secures enough skill-points.
I chose Ro7/ SD3 over Ro8/ SD2 and Ro9/ SD1. Ro8 only gives 2 more skill-points. Ro9 gives 1d6 SA, but costs -1 AB. SD3 gives shadow daze.
I chose a sling because it has +1 to AB and because you get 4 attacks per round with rapid shot. 4 attacks gives 2 attacks in the first flurry, meaning you attack with two attacks simultaneously when you start combat from stealth.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey guys!

Mick is right, you see! I am quite experienced (and not very modest as you can see lol), so I was able to understand the reasoning behind his choices by looking at the build. He only has 20 levels, so he can't do one thing that is vital to do when POWERbuilding for level 40, which is building up BAB (for explanation on this, please read my Complete Guide to the Basics of Building in the Game Guides section). The leveling order and even level 20 spread would have probably been Rogue 12 Assassin 8 if Mick had 40 levels to play with, because the SD level would cost him a BAB point. I love the finesse with which he was able to attain both 50% concealment and 14 BAB by slightly bending the Rule of 4 and still got Shadow Daze as a small reward for his effort. UDAMAN Mick!

I have to say, though, that Mick's pointed out Tomi build is not mine. It's actually Grimnir77's Tiny Reaper build which I "borrowed" with his consent because I thought it'd fit Tomi perfectly (and I needed to modify it a bit too because Tomi wields Kukris).

I like your attitude CT! You're an ACTIVE LEARNER, such as myself, so if you want to chat about making builds, I'll be more than happy to help you out. PM me and we can exchange ideas and chat, brother!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I'm sure Mick ran this through as a human just to compare.  Of course it will work that way (re: human), just not near as good.

What you'll lose by not going with halfling (add them all up to get the final penalty):
-2 DEX: that mean -1 AB, -1 AC, -1 reflex in a finessed and ranged build (DEX will be 17/22)
-1 AB, sling: that's a racial bonus for halfling
-1 AB, -1 AC: that's small stature.  works the same for a gnome.
-4 detection (listen/spot): another small stature bonus
-4 stealth (hide/mv sil): still another small stature bonus
-2 listen: skill affinity
-2 mv sil: skill affinity
-1/-1/-1 f/w/r saves: lucky
a fear save boost vs. spells

What you'll gain as human:
1 feat (your choice)
Over 20 more skill points (23 IIRC)
Able to use tower shield, large weapons and be able to one-hand medium weapons w/shield

All else should remain the same, but Mick will correct me when he shows. I may have missed something important.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Hip is right. Well neither class has shield proficiency, but Hip is right none the less. He points out excactly why this is a halfling build.

I am everything but an expert, but this guide might answer some of your questions: skills-where-to-stop-t2331487.html

Now locks and traps... will depend on the surrounding. Maybe somebody who is playing in the same PW (or the same module) can tell you how many skill points you need.

posts.content:
Both your builds are very good builds. You have indeed demonstrated two different ways of qualifying for Epic Dodge. The second build gets earlier HIPS, gets better Death attack DC, has slightly lower sneak damage and slightly lower saves. Less rogue also means 8 skillpoints less. The second build also gets Shadow evade (for what it's worth).

My original build has the skills needed for handling (recovering included) of all vanilla Deadly traps in a PvM setting. In a lvl 30 build handling of epic traps becomes an option. You need a modified Set trap skill of 45 to set epic traps. You want to max your search skill to detect them earlier (you need a modified search rank of 42 to detect vanilla epic traps immediately in PvM. To disarm those traps you need a modified rank of 38.

If you ask me how I would  convert THIS build to a lvl 30 build, my primary concern is to stay true to the original concepts of the build. That also means to max out assassin to keep the Death attack DC at Maximum (DC=33).
That means Rogue 7/Assassin 20/SD 3. So no ED and less skillpoints. I also have to live with BAB 19, but get a higher Dexterity from assassin bonus feats that compensates for that.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
As a Dexer you have a variety of tactics and weapons that you can fall back on.

The main one being HiPS - as long as your opponent does not have TS (and even if it does, you can still spam vanilla HiPS to "break" both spellcasting and attacks).

You could go Sword and Board - and since you have Weapon Finesse, you are probably looking at Shortsword as your goto.  A rapier would be fantastic, as you could use it two-handed and still get the use of Weapon Finesse!  Especially against foes who have poor AB but high dr.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
...and traps. You can set a lovely little minefield for bad dudes, ping one or two of them with your sling, watch them suffer, then HiPS in and out as you administer Death/Sneak Attacks. Nice.

Mick, of course, may have other guidance...

Welcome aboard, Mappo!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hi Mappo, and Welcome!
I think Web and Stag already covered many of the options. The build benefits from the fact that halflings get a bonus to AB with slings and throwing weapons. You can always resort to melee, but you don't need to. HIPS is very good for crowd control. Rapiers are finessable medium sized weapons. Halflings and gnomes wield them as two-handers and cannot finesse them. And none of the 3 classes in this build has the shield proficiency. Using traps is definitely an option. Wands, rods, mage weapons and other items with spells to cast also add to the versatility.
